choices.text:
Birria Tacos

Ingredients:

- 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
2 1/2 pounds beef chuck roast
Kosher salt
Freshly ground black pepper
2-3 tablespoons birria seasoning
2 onions, chopped
6 cloves garlic, minced
2 teaspoon ground cumin
2 teaspoon dried oregano
1/4 teaspoon ground cloves
1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1 can (14.5 ounces) diced tomatoes
1 can (4 ounces) diced green chiles, drained
1/2 cup beef broth
3 cups cooked pinto beans
Warm corn tortillas
Optional Toppings:
Shredded Mexican cheese, diced jalapeño, chopped cilantro, lime wedges, sour cream

Instructions:

1. Heat the olive oil in a large Dutch oven or heavy pot over medium heat. Season the chuck roast generously with salt and pepper. Add the roast to the pot and cook until browned on all sides, about 8 to 10 minutes.

2. Sprinkle the birria seasoning over the roast. Add the onions, garlic, cumin, oregano, cloves, and cinnamon. Stir to combine. Cook for an additional 5 minutes.

3. Add the diced tomatoes, green chiles, and beef broth. Simmer, uncovered, for 2 hours, stirring occasionally.

4. After 2 hours, the roast should be tender and the sauce thick. Remove the roast from the pot. Shred the meat with two forks and add it back to the pot. Add the pinto beans and stir to combine.

5. Simmer for an additional 20 minutes.

6. To assemble the tacos, heat the corn tortillas on a griddle or in a dry skillet. Fill each with a scoop of the birria filling. Top with cheese, jalapeño, cilantro, lime wedges, and sour cream, if desired. Serve immediately.
